*** Bug 97823 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This is usually caused by some other process or thread that has an open file
handle on the file being deleted (in this case
C:\CODE\javaProject\META-INF\MANIFEST.MF). Questions:

 - Did you have any other program running that might have had that file open?  
 - Could you delete the file from Windows Explorer?
 - Could you delete the file after shutting down Eclipse?

Note this is in 3.0.1. Wassim, wasn't there a bug at some point about the
manifest editor preventing deletion? (I did a quick search but couldn't find
anything)

correct.  there was a scenario when PDE was neglecting to close an input 
stream.  not sure if it was in 3.0.x or the beginning of 3.1 though.

There is this one: bug 84438. But it was about not closing a plugin.xml file. 

Wassim, looking at FormEditor#close it seems if a runtime exception happens
while closing one of the pages, the editors in the other pages will not be
closed. Couldn't that have left an input stream open?

re comment 7, what code are you looking at?  from HEAD or 3.0.x?  If from 
head, I can't seem to map what you are referring to to code.
Never mind, just pretend I am not here... I saw a loop where there was none.

Marking invalid.  The claim is that this has been fixed, although I couldn't
find a bug reference. Please reopen if this can be reproduced in 3.1 stream builds.

error log 

Some more information about our development environment.

We are working on Bundle Developer Toolkit which is a plugin to Rational
Application Developer (RAD) 6.0.
RAD 6.0 is using Eclipse Platform Version: 3.0.1.1 

Attached a text file containing error messages displayed on "Error Log" window.


Mean while we will try to verify this defect on eclipse 3.1 based platform
